message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is about improving the efficiency and effectiveness of multi-stage retrieval systems, which are commonly used in information retrieval (IR) applications. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also proposes a new approach that uses machine learning techniques to predict the optimal tradeoff between efficiency and effectiveness on a per-query basis, which involves classification and optimization, suggesting that it could also fit into categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper mentions using static pre-retrieval features, which could relate to natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Finally, the paper involves experimentation and evaluation, which could also relate to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
